Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Driver
  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class that allows the user to control the robot's movements.

    • Method Detail

      • turnBy

        public static void turnBy​(double angle)
        Turns the robot by a specified angle. Note that this method is different from Navigation.turnTo(). For example, if the robot is facing 90 degrees, calling turnBy(90) will make the robot turn to 180 degrees, but calling Navigation.turnTo(90) should do nothing (since the robot is already at 90 degrees).
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle by which to turn, in degrees

      • moveStraightFor

        public static void moveStraightFor​(double distance)
        Moves the robot straight for the given distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - in feet (tile sizes), may be negative

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance​(double distance)
        Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - the input distance in meters
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to cover the distance

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle​(double angle)
        Converts input angle to the total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate the robot by that angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - the input angle in degrees
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to rotate the robot by the angle

      • stopMotors

        public static void stopMotors()
        Stops both motors.

      • setSpeed

        public static void setSpeed​(int speed)
        Sets the speed of both motors to the same values.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed in degrees per second

      • setSpeeds

        public static void setSpeeds​(int leftSpeed,
                             int rightSpeed)
        Sets the speed of both motors to different values.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - the speed of the left motor in degrees per second
        rightSpeed - the speed of the right motor in degrees per second

      • setAcceleration

        public static void setAcceleration​(int acceleration)
        Sets the acceleration of both motors.
        Parameters:
        acceleration - the acceleration in degrees per second squared

      • rotateClk

        public static void rotateClk()
        Makes the robot rotate clockwise

      • rotateCClk

        public static void rotateCClk()
        Makes the robot rotate counter clockwise

      • forward

        public static void forward()
        Moves the robot forward for an indeterminate distance.

      • backward

        public static void backward()
        Moves the robot backward for an indeterminate distance.

      • isNavigating

        public static boolean isNavigating()
        Returns whether robot is moving/navigating
